item.title: I due figli di Ringo
item.description: Two Sons of Ringo is a 1966 Italian western-parody film. It was the last film directed by Giorgio Simonelli who, for health reasons, left the production just before the end of filming and was replaced by Giuliano Carnimeo.

item.title: Have a Good Funeral, My Friend... Sartana Will Pay
item.description: Have a Good Funeral, My Friend... Sartana Will Pay is a 1970 Spaghetti Western film directed by Giuliano Carnimeo, written by Roberto Gianviti and starring Gianni Garko.

item.title: Une corde
item.description: Cemetery Without Crosses, is a 1969 Spaghetti Western film by Robert Hossein, its director, co-screenwriter and star.

item.title: Any Gun Can Play
item.description: Any Gun Can Play is a 1967 spaghetti western starring Gilbert Roland, Edd Byrnes and George Hilton. The film is directed by Enzo G. Castellari. The film is about a group of cowboys searching for gold, double-leading to double crosses as they continually change allegiances and get the upper hand only to be thwarted by fellow outlaws, mysterious insurance investigators and each other.

item.title: The Nephews of Zorro
item.description: The Nephews of Zorro is a 1968 Italian comedy film directed by Marcello Ciorciolini.

item.title: And the Crows Will Dig Your Grave
item.description: And the Crows Will Dig Your Grave is a 1971 Spanish western film directed by Juan Bosch and starring Craig Hill, Fernando Sancho and Dominique Boschero. It is composed by Bruno Nicolai.

item.title: Arizona Colt
item.description: Arizona Colt, also known as The Man from Nowhere, is a Spaghetti Western directed by Michele Lupo and starring Giuliano Gemma, Fernando Sancho and Corinne Marchand.

item.title: 30 Winchester per El Diablo
item.description: 30 Winchester per El Diablo is a 1965 Italian spaghetti western film directed and written by Gianfranco Baldanello. The film stars Carl Möhner and has occasionally been mistaken for a German western.

item.title: God Made Them... I Kill Them
item.description: God Made Them... I Kill Them is a 1968 Italian Spaghetti Western film written by Fernando Di Leo and directed by Paolo Bianchini.

item.title: I due figli di Ringo
item.description: I due figli di Ringo ist eine im deutschen Sprachraum nicht gezeigte Italowestern-Parodie, die 1966 von Giorgio Simonelli inszeniert wurde.
